description.raw:
The pull request implements a level system based on the idea that a simulation runner is responsible for loading and unloading all levels in the world.

## Dependencies:

* ~~ign-physics branch [remove_model_features](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/branch/remove_entity_features)~~
      * ~~Which in turn depends on ign-physics [pull request #46](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/46/)~~
* ~~ign-gui [pull request #182](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/182)~~


## TODOs:

* ~~Send only new entities to ign-gui instead of the whole scene when new entities are added~~
* ~~Add tests for the level manager.~~

## To test
Create a benchmark world using `benchmark.world.erb`

```
$ erb n_x=8 n_y=8 test/worlds/benchmark.sdf.erb > test/worlds/benchmark.sdf
```
Run ign-gazebo with `--levels` flag
```
$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -f test/worlds/benchmark.sdf --levels
```
Before starting the simulation, publish command velocities to the red and green vehicles.

```
ign topic -t "/model/vehicle_red/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.5}"
ign topic -t "/model/vehicle_blue/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.5}"

```
Then start the simulation.

## Levels on
![ign_gazebo_levels_on2.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1414413745-ign_gazebo_levels_on2.gif)
## Levels off
![ign_gazebo_levels_off2.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2684170126-ign_gazebo_levels_off2.gif)
description.html:
The pull request implements a level system based on the idea that a simulation runner is responsible for loading and unloading all levels in the world.

Dependencies:

  • ign-physics branch remove_model_features
    • Which in turn depends on ign-physics pull request #46
  • ign-gui pull request #182

TODOs:

  • Send only new entities to ign-gui instead of the whole scene when new entities are added
  • Add tests for the level manager.

To test

Create a benchmark world using benchmark.world.erb

$ erb n_x=8 n_y=8 test/worlds/benchmark.sdf.erb > test/worlds/benchmark.sdf

Run ign-gazebo with --levels flag

$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -f test/worlds/benchmark.sdf --levels

Before starting the simulation, publish command velocities to the red and green vehicles.

ign topic -t "/model/vehicle_red/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.5}"
ign topic -t "/model/vehicle_blue/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.5}"

Then start the simulation.

Levels on

Levels off

title: [A-1] Levels
